content: Historic building in SingaporeThis article includes a list of references, related reading, or external links, **but its sources remain unclear because it lacks inline citations**. Please help improve this article by introducing more precise citations. *(January 2019)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* The **College of Medicine Building** ([Malay](/wiki/Malay_language): *Bangunan Maktab Perubatan*; [Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese): 医药学院大厦) is a historic building in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), located within the grounds of the [Singapore General Hospital](/wiki/Singapore_General_Hospital) at [Outram Park](/wiki/Outram,_Singapore), within the [Bukit Merah Planning Area](/wiki/Bukit_Merah_Planning_Area) near Singapore's [central business district](/wiki/Central_business_district). Its name comes from its former function as the location for the [King Edward VII College of Medicine](/wiki/King_Edward_VII_College_of_Medicine), the first school of medicine in [British Malaya](/wiki/British_Malaya) (Present day: [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia) and [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)). - National Heritage Board (2002), *Singapore's 100 Historic Places*, Archipelago Press, [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 981-4068-23-3 - Norman Edwards, Peter Keys (1996), *Singapore - A Guide to Buildings, Streets, Places*, Times Books International, [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 9971-65-231-5 - Edwin Lee (1990), *Historic Buildings of Singapore*, Preservation of Monuments Board, [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 9971-88-224-8 - Teo ES. "The history of the College of Medicine and Tan Teck Guan Buildings". *Annals of the Academy of Medicine of Singapore*. 2005 Jul;34(6):61C-71C. - KE VII College of Medicine: Snapshots through the years
title: College of Medicine Building
